team.name: Xbox Support Content Team
team.description: A specialized team of content creators, editors, and designers responsible for crafting support content across the Xbox ecosystem.

pipeline.name: Content Planning
pipeline.description: Research, audience analysis, and content strategy development

pipeline.name: Technical Review
pipeline.description: Accuracy verification by subject matter experts

pipeline.name: Localization
pipeline.description: Translation and cultural adaptation for 40+ markets

members.name: Alex Rivera
members.bio: With over 12 years in technical documentation and content strategy, Alex leads the Xbox Support Content Team with a focus on accessibility and global reach. Previously worked at Microsoft Documentation and Azure teams.
members.quote: Great support content doesn't just solve problems—it empowers players and builds trust in the Xbox ecosystem.

members.name: Morgan Chen
members.bio: Morgan specializes in creating clear, concise technical documentation for complex features. Expert in information architecture and user-centered content design with a background in game development.
members.quote: The best technical writing is the kind you don't notice—it just helps you solve your problem and get back to gaming.

members.name: Jordan Taylor
members.bio: Jordan creates visual guides, infographics, and UI mockups that simplify complex procedures. Specializes in creating visuals that work across languages and cultural contexts.
members.quote: A well-designed visual can explain in seconds what might take paragraphs of text—and it works in any language.

members.name: Sam Washington
members.bio: Sam ensures consistency and clarity across all Xbox support content. Maintains the team's style guide and editorial standards while optimizing content for search and readability.
members.quote: Consistency isn't just about grammar—it's about creating a trustworthy voice that players recognize across every touchpoint.

members.name: Taylor Rodriguez
members.bio: Taylor builds and maintains the team's publishing tools and automation systems. Expert in content APIs, single-source publishing, and creating developer documentation.
members.quote: Great content systems should be invisible to the end user but transformative for content creators.

members.name: Jamie Patel
members.bio: Jamie coordinates the localization of Xbox support content into 40+ languages. Expert in creating globally-friendly source content and managing translation workflows.
members.quote: True localization isn't just translation—it's making content feel native to each market while maintaining the Xbox voice.

members.name: Casey Kim
members.bio: Casey ensures all Xbox support content meets or exceeds accessibility standards. Expert in screen reader optimization, plain language, and creating content for users with diverse needs.
members.quote: Accessible content isn't a checkbox—it's a commitment to ensuring everyone can get the help they need, regardless of ability.

members.name: Riley Johnson
members.bio: Riley tests support content for accuracy, clarity, and effectiveness. Conducts user research and A/B testing to continuously improve the help experience.
members.quote: The true measure of support content quality isn't what we think of it—it's whether it actually helps users solve their problems.
